mal:area.name: MALPrototype
mal:area.comment: The MALPrototype area defines data types, services and operations used to test the proper implementation of the MAL requirements.

mal:service.name: IPTest
mal:service.comment:
This service aims at testing each Interaction Pattern (IP). It provides one operation for Send, Submit, Request, Invoke and Progress. The input parameter is an IPTestDefinition that contains:
- The parameters used by the consumer in order to initiate the interaction. These parameters enable the provider to check whether the received message header is correct or not.
- A list of interaction transitions expected by the consumer.
An operation 'getResult' is provided in order to enable the consumer to get:
- the interaction transaction identifier
- and the assertions evaluated on the provider side during an interaction.
Finally four operations 'monitor', 'publishUpdates' and 'publishError' are provided in order to test the Pub/Sub interaction.

mal:sendIP.name: send
mal:sendIP.comment: This operation cleans the assertions table and check that the header of the received message is the same as the one expected (see 4.1.1).

mal:submitIP.name: testSubmit
mal:submitIP.comment: This operation cleans the assertions table and checks that the header of the received message is the same as the one expected (see 4.1.1). Moreover it triggers the transitions specified by the IPTestDefinition (see 3.1.1.1).

mal:requestIP.name: request
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation cleans the assertions table and checks that the header of the received message is the same as the one expected (see 4.1.1). Moreover it triggers the transitions specified by the IPTestDefinition (see 3.1.1.1).

mal:invokeIP.name: invoke
mal:invokeIP.comment: This operation cleans the assertions table and checks that the header of the received message is the same as the one expected (see 4.1.1). Moreover it triggers the transitions specified by the IPTestDefinition (see 3.1.1.1).

mal:progressIP.name: progress
mal:progressIP.comment: This operation cleans the assertions table and checks that the header of the received message is the same as the one expected (see 4.1.1). Moreover it triggers the transitions specified by the IPTestDefinition (see 3.1.1.1).

mal:pubsubIP.name: monitor
mal:pubsubIP.comment: This operation initiates a Pub/Sub interaction. It is not implemented by the service provider but by a broker.

mal:errorRef.comment: One or more of the entities identified in the registration do not exist.

mal:requestIP.name: getResult
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation returns an IPTestResult.

mal:submitIP.name: publishUpdates
mal:submitIP.comment: This operation cleans the assertions table, publishes an update as specified by the parameter TestPublishUpdate and checks the header of the Publish message (see 4.1.3). Moreover if an error is expected by the TestPublishUpdate then the operation hangs until a Publish error is raised or a timer ends (see 4.1.10). The header of the Publish error message is checked (see 4.1.4).

mal:submitIP.name: publishRegister
mal:submitIP.comment: This operation cleans the assertions table, registers a publisher as specified by the parameter TestPublishRegister and checks the header of the Publish Register message (see 4.1.5). Moreover if no error is expected by the TestPublishRegister, it checks the header of the Publish Register acknowledgement message (see 4.1.6). Otherwise it checks the header of the Publish Register error message (see 4.1.7).

mal:submitIP.name: publishDeregister
mal:submitIP.comment: This operation cleans the assertions table, registers a publisher as specified by the parameter TestPublishDeregister and checks the header of the Publish Deregister message (see 4.1.5). Moreover if no error is expected by the TestPublishDeregister, it checks the header of the Publish Deregister acknowledgement message (see 4.1.8). Otherwise it checks the header of the Publish Deregister error message (see 4.1.9).

mal:sendIP.name: sendMulti
mal:sendIP.comment: This operation duplicates the send operation with an additional IN parameter.

mal:submitIP.name: submitMulti
mal:submitIP.comment: This operation duplicates the testSubmit operation with an additional IN parameter.

mal:requestIP.name: requestMulti
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation duplicates the request operation with an additional IN parameter.

mal:invokeIP.name: invokeMulti
mal:invokeIP.comment: This operation cleans the assertions table and checks that the header of the received message is the same as the one expected (see 4.1.1). Moreover it triggers the transitions specified by the IPTestDefinition (see 4.1.2).

mal:progressIP.name: progressMulti
mal:progressIP.comment: This operation duplicates the progress operation with an additional IN parameter.

mal:pubsubIP.name: monitorMulti
mal:pubsubIP.comment: This operation duplicates the monitor operation with an additional IN parameter.

mal:errorRef.comment: One or more of the entities identified in the registration do not exist.

mal:requestIP.name: testRequestEmptyBody
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that an empty body can be sent and received explicitly for a request pattern

mal:invokeIP.name: testInvokeEmptyBody
mal:invokeIP.comment: This operation checks that an empty body can be sent and received explicitly for an Invoke pattern

mal:progressIP.name: testProgressEmptyBody
mal:progressIP.comment: This operation checks that an empty body can be sent and received explicitly for a Progress pattern

mal:service.name: DataTest
mal:service.comment:
This service aims at testing the data structures.
It provides an operation 'testData' that enables to transmit any Element to the provider and check that it is well interpreted by the provider.

mal:submitIP.name: setTestDataOffset
mal:submitIP.comment: This operation sets the index into the test list for the testData operation. Passing non positive values resets it to the start of the list.

mal:requestIP.name: testData
mal:requestIP.comment: The 'testData' operation allows a consumer to check that a data is correctly decoded on the provider side, then that the same data sent back by the provider is correctly decoded on the consumer side. The provider needs to statically know the list of data that the consumer is going to send. The consumer selects the data in the same order as the list and calls the operation 'testData'. The provider keeps the index of the currently selected data from the static list. When the operation 'testData' is called, the provider checks that the received data is equal to the selected data from the list. If the equality test fails, then the error DATA_ERROR is raised, otherwise the provider returns the decoded data. When the consumer receives the returned data, it checks that this data is equal to the original data it sent.

mal:requestIP.name: testDataBlob
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a basic Blob type can be sent and received explicitly

mal:requestIP.name: testDataBoolean
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a basic Boolean type can be sent and received explicitly

mal:requestIP.name: testDataDouble
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a basic Double type can be sent and received explicitly

mal:requestIP.name: testDataDuration
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a basic Duration type can be sent and received explicitly

mal:requestIP.name: testDataFineTime
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a basic FineTime type can be sent and received explicitly

mal:requestIP.name: testDataFloat
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a basic Float type can be sent and received explicitly

mal:requestIP.name: testDataIdentifier
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a basic Identifier type can be sent and received explicitly

mal:requestIP.name: testDataInteger
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a basic Integer type can be sent and received explicitly

mal:requestIP.name: testDataLong
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a basic Long type can be sent and received explicitly

mal:requestIP.name: testDataOctet
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a basic Octet type can be sent and received explicitly

mal:requestIP.name: testDataShort
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a basic Short type can be sent and received explicitly

mal:requestIP.name: testDataString
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a basic String type can be sent and received explicitly

mal:requestIP.name: testDataTime
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a basic Time type can be sent and received explicitly

mal:requestIP.name: testDataURI
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a basic URI type can be sent and received explicitly

mal:requestIP.name: testDataComposite
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a composite type can be sent and received explicitly

mal:requestIP.name: testDataEnumeration
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a enumeration type can be sent and received explicitly

mal:requestIP.name: testDataList
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a list type can be sent and received explicitly

mal:requestIP.name: testDataUInteger
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a basic UInteger type can be sent and received explicitly

mal:requestIP.name: testDataULong
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a basic ULong type can be sent and received explicitly

mal:requestIP.name: testDataUOctet
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a basic UOctet type can be sent and received explicitly

mal:requestIP.name: testDataUShort
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a basic UShort type can be sent and received explicitly

mal:requestIP.name: testExplicitMultiReturn
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that multiple types can be sent and received explicitly

mal:requestIP.name: testAbstractMultiReturn
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that multiple types with a final abstract type can be sent and received explicitly

mal:requestIP.name: testEmptyBody
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that an empty body can be sent and received explicitly

mal:requestIP.name: testMalAttribute
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a MAL::Attribute can be sent and received as an abstract Attribute

mal:requestIP.name: testMalComposite
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a Composite can be sent and received as a MAL Composite. It is no longer used in the testbed.

mal:requestIP.name: testAbstractComposite
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a Composite can be sent and received as an abstract Composite. It is no longer used in the testbed.

mal:requestIP.name: testMalAttributeList
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a list of MAL::Attribute can be sent and received explicitly. It is no longer used in the testbed.

mal:requestIP.name: testMalElementList
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a list of MAL::Element can be sent and received explicitly. It is no longer used in the testbed.

mal:requestIP.name: testMalCompositeList
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a list of MAL::Composite can be sent and received explicitly. It is no longer used in the testbed.

mal:requestIP.name: testAbstractCompositeList
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a list of abstract composite can be sent and received explicitly. It is no longer used in the testbed.

mal:requestIP.name: testDataObjectRef
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that a basic ObjectRef type can be sent and received explicitly

mal:requestIP.name: testInnerAbstractMultiReturn
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that multiple types with a not final abstract type can be sent and received explicitly

mal:requestIP.name: testPolymorphicAbstractCompositeList
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that various concrete values can be sent and received explicitly as a list of abstract composite

mal:requestIP.name: testPolymorphicMalCompositeList
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that various concrete values can be sent and received explicitly as a list of MAL Composite

mal:requestIP.name: testPolymorphicMalElementList
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation checks that various concrete values can be sent and received explicitly as a list of MAL Element

mal:requestIP.name: testPolymorphicObjectRefTypes
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation checks the ObjectRef(T) polymorphism in operation type signature and in composite fields

mal:requestIP.name: createObject
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation creates a new MO Object from a full value

mal:requestIP.name: createObjectFromFields
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation creates a new MO Object from fields values

mal:submitIP.name: deleteObject
mal:submitIP.comment: This operation deletes an MO Object

mal:requestIP.name: getObject
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation gets an MO Object value from its reference

mal:service.name: ErrorTest
mal:service.comment: This service aims at testing the MAL errors. It doesn't need to be implemented as it is only used on the consumer side to make the transport layer raise errors (see section 3.3).

mal:requestIP.name: testDeliveryFailed
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation does nothing. Actually the error is raised by the transport layer before the provider is invoked.

mal:requestIP.name: testDeliveryTimedout
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation does nothing. Actually the error is raised by the transport layer before the provider is invoked.

mal:requestIP.name: testDeliveryDelayed
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation does nothing. Actually the error is raised by the transport layer before the provider is invoked.

mal:requestIP.name: testDestinationUnknown
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation does nothing. Actually the error is raised by the transport layer before the provider is invoked.

mal:requestIP.name: testDestinationTransient
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation does nothing. Actually the error is raised by the transport layer before the provider is invoked.

mal:requestIP.name: testDestinationLost
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation does nothing. Actually the error is raised by the transport layer before the provider is invoked.

mal:requestIP.name: testEncryptionFail
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation does nothing. Actually the error is raised by the transport layer before the provider is invoked.

mal:requestIP.name: testUnsupportedArea
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation does nothing. Actually the error is raised by the transport layer before the provider is invoked.

mal:requestIP.name: testUnsupportedOperation
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation does nothing. Actually the error is raised by the transport layer before the provider is invoked.

mal:requestIP.name: testUnsupportedAreaVersion
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation does nothing. Actually the error is raised by the transport layer before the provider is invoked.

mal:requestIP.name: testBadEncoding
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation does nothing. Actually the error is raised by the transport layer before the provider is invoked.

mal:requestIP.name: testUnknown
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation does nothing. Actually the error is raised by the transport layer before the provider is invoked.

mal:requestIP.name: testAuthenticationFailure
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation does nothing. Actually the error is raised by the MAL layer before the provider is invoked.

mal:requestIP.name: testAuthorizationFailure
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation does nothing. Actually the error is raised by the MAL layer before the provider is invoked.

mal:requestIP.name: testUnsupportedService
mal:requestIP.comment: This operation does nothing. Actually the error is raised by the transport layer before the provider is invoked.

mal:pubsubIP.name: monitor
mal:pubsubIP.comment: This operation initiates a Pub/Sub interaction. It is not implemented by the service provider but by a broker.

mal:errorRef.comment: One or more of the entities identified in the registration do not exist.

mal:submitIP.name: publishUpdates
mal:submitIP.comment: This operation cleans the assertions table, publishes an update as specified by the parameter TestPublishUpdate and checks the header of the Publish message (see 4.1.3). Moreover if an error is expected by the TestPublishUpdate then the operation hangs until a Publish error is raised or a timer ends (see 4.1.10). The header of the Publish error message is checked (see 4.1.4).

mal:submitIP.name: publishRegister
mal:submitIP.comment: This operation cleans the assertions table, registers a publisher as specified by the parameter TestPublishRegister and checks the header of the Publish Register message (see 4.1.5). Moreover if no error is expected by the TestPublishRegister, it checks the header of the Publish Register acknowledgement message (see 4.1.6). Otherwise it checks the header of the Publish Register error message (see 4.1.7).

mal:submitIP.name: publishDeregister
mal:submitIP.comment: This operation cleans the assertions table, registers a publisher as specified by the parameter TestPublishDeregister and checks the header of the Publish Deregister message (see 4.1.5). Moreover if no error is expected by the TestPublishDeregister, it checks the header of the Publish Deregister acknowledgement message (see 4.1.8). Otherwise it checks the header of the Publish Deregister error message (see 4.1.9).

mal:field.name: procedureName
mal:field.comment: Name of the test procedure that evaluated the assertion.

mal:field.name: Info
mal:field.comment: Message explaining what the assertion checks.

mal:field.name: Result
mal:field.comment: Boolean indicating whether the assertion succeeded (true) or not (false).

mal:field.name: procedureName
mal:field.comment: Name of the test procedure that evaluated the assertion.

mal:field.name: Info
mal:field.comment: Message explaining what the assertion checks.

mal:field.name: Result
mal:field.comment: Boolean indicating whether the assertion succeeded (true) or not (false).

mal:composite.name: IPTestDefinition
mal:composite.comment: This abstract structure is inherited by all the IP test definition structures.

mal:field.name: procedureName
mal:field.comment: Name of the test procedure

mal:field.name: consumerURI
mal:field.comment: The consumer's URI

mal:field.name: authenticationId
mal:field.comment: The authentication identifier used by the consumer

mal:field.name: Qos
mal:field.comment: The QoS level required by the consumer

mal:field.name: Priority
mal:field.comment: The priority level required by the consumer

mal:field.name: Domain
mal:field.comment: The domain used by the consumer

mal:field.name: networkZone
mal:field.comment: The network zone used by the consumer

mal:field.name: Session
mal:field.comment: The type of the session used by the consumer

mal:field.name: sessionName
mal:field.comment: The identifier of the session used by the consumer

mal:field.name: supplements
mal:field.comment: The supplements field used by the consumer

mal:field.name: transitions
mal:field.comment: The transitions that are requested by the consumer

mal:field.name: timestamp
mal:field.comment: The time the consumer initiated the interaction.

mal:composite.name: IPTestTransition
mal:composite.comment: This structure is used to define an expected transition from an IP test. It asserts what transition is expected and what result is expected from the transition: successful or failure.

mal:field.name: Type
mal:field.comment: The type of the transition to do

mal:field.name: errorCode
mal:field.comment: The code of the error expected to be raised when doing the transition (failed transition).-1 if no error is expected (successful transition).

mal:composite.name: BadHeaderReport
mal:composite.comment: This data structure is an error report produced after having found a faulty header.

mal:field.name: expectedHeader
mal:field.comment: The expected header

mal:field.name: faultyHeader
mal:field.comment: The header that is not compliant with the MAL rules

mal:composite.name: TestPublish
mal:composite.comment: This abstract structure is a publish context.

mal:field.name: Qos
mal:field.comment: The QoS level to be used by the provider.

mal:field.name: Priority
mal:field.comment: The priority to be used by the provider.

mal:field.name: domain
mal:field.comment: The domain to be used by the provider.

mal:field.name: networkZone
mal:field.comment: The network zone to be used by the provider.

mal:field.name: Session
mal:field.comment: The session type to be used by the provider.

mal:field.name: sessionName
mal:field.comment: The session name to be used by the provider.

mal:field.name: testMultiType
mal:field.comment: Whether to use the multi type version of the PubSub operation.

mal:composite.name: TestPublishRegister
mal:composite.comment: This data structure specifies how the IPTest provider shall register.

mal:field.name: keyNames
mal:field.comment: The names of the keys to be used by the broker.

mal:field.name: keyTypes
mal:field.comment: The types of the keys to be used by the broker.

mal:field.name: errorCode
mal:field.comment: The code of the Publish Register error expected to be received.-1 if no Publish Register error is expected.

mal:composite.name: TestPublishDeregister
mal:composite.comment: This data structure specifies how the IPTest provider shall register.

mal:field.name: errorCode
mal:field.comment: The code of the Publish Deregister error expected to be received.-1 if no Publish Deregister error is expected.

mal:composite.name: TestPublishUpdate
mal:composite.comment: This data structure specifies how the IPTest provider shall publish an update.

mal:field.name: updateHeaders
mal:field.comment: The headers of the updates to be published by the provider

mal:field.name: updates
mal:field.comment: The updates to be published by the provider

mal:field.name: keyValues
mal:field.comment: The list of key values

mal:field.name: errorCode
mal:field.comment: The code of the Publish error expected to be received.-1 if no Publish error is expected.

mal:field.name: isException
mal:field.comment: Indicates whether the error is returned as an Exception or a Publish Error message

mal:field.name: failedKeyValues
mal:field.comment: The list of failed keys values.

mal:composite.name: TestUpdate
mal:composite.comment: This data structure defines an Update published by the IPTest.

mal:field.name: Counter
mal:field.comment: A counter used to distinguish the test updates and to check the ordering.

mal:field.name: URIfrom
mal:field.comment: The consumer's URI

mal:field.name: transactionId
mal:field.comment: The transaction identifier of the interaction

mal:field.name: interactionType
mal:field.comment: The type of the interaction

mal:field.name: Service
mal:field.comment: The name of the called service

mal:field.name: operation
mal:field.comment: The name of the called operation

mal:field.name: transactionId
mal:field.comment: The transaction identifier assigned to the last interaction

mal:field.name: assertions
mal:field.comment: The list of assertions checked by the provider.

mal:composite.name: MessageHeader
mal:composite.comment: The MessageHeader structure is used to hold all fields that are passed for each message exchanged between a consumer and provider. See 4.1 for more information.

mal:field.name: URIfrom
mal:field.comment: Message Source URI

mal:field.name: authenticationId
mal:field.comment: Source Authentication Credentials

mal:field.name: URIto
mal:field.comment: Message Destination URI

mal:field.name: timestamp
mal:field.comment: Message generation timestamp

mal:field.name: QoSlevel
mal:field.comment: The QoS level of the message

mal:field.name: priority
mal:field.comment: The QoS priority of the message

mal:field.name: domain
mal:field.comment: Domain of the message

mal:field.name: networkZone
mal:field.comment: Network zone of the message

mal:field.name: session
mal:field.comment: Type of session of the message

mal:field.name: sessionName
mal:field.comment: Name of the session of the message. Shall be ‘LIVE’ if session type is LIVE.

mal:field.name: interactionType
mal:field.comment: Interaction Pattern Type

mal:field.name: interactionStage
mal:field.comment: Interaction Pattern Stage

mal:field.name: transactionId
mal:field.comment: Unique to consumer

mal:field.name: area
mal:field.comment: Service Area Identifier

mal:field.name: service
mal:field.comment: Service Identifier

mal:field.name: operation
mal:field.comment: Service Operation Identifier

mal:field.name: version
mal:field.comment: Service version

mal:field.name: isError
mal:field.comment: True if this is an error message else False.

mal:composite.name: Auto
mal:composite.comment: An abstract object type for cars. This type and all derived types are notably used in the Polymorphic types test procedure related to ObjectRef.

mal:field.name: engine
mal:field.comment: The engine of the car.

mal:field.name: chassis
mal:field.comment: The chassis of the car.

mal:field.name: windows
mal:field.comment: The windows of the car.

mal:composite.name: Lamborghini
mal:composite.comment: The object representing a Lamborghini car.

mal:composite.name: Porsche
mal:composite.comment: The object representing a Porsche car.

mal:composite.name: Garage
mal:composite.comment: The object representing a Garage with multiple references and lists of references to cars.

mal:field.name: courtesyCarAsPorsche
mal:field.comment: The Porsche courtesy car offered by the garage.

mal:field.name: courtesyCarAsAuto
mal:field.comment: The courtesy car offered by the garage.

mal:field.name: courtesyCarAsObject
mal:field.comment: The courtesy car offered by the garage.

mal:field.name: carsAsPorsches
mal:field.comment: The list of Porsche cars parked in the garage.

mal:field.name: carsAsAutos
mal:field.comment: The list of cars parked in the garage.

mal:field.name: carsAsObjects
mal:field.comment: The list of cars parked in the garage.

mal:composite.name: TestObjectBase
mal:composite.comment: An abstract MO Object structure.

mal:field.name: firstItem
mal:field.comment: Example String item.

mal:field.name: secondItem
mal:field.comment: Example Integer item.

mal:composite.name: TestObject
mal:composite.comment: A concrete MO Object structure which does not extend directly the MAL Object type.

mal:field.name: thirdItem
mal:field.comment: Another example String item.

mal:field.name: fourthItem
mal:field.comment: Example Boolean item.

mal:composite.name: TestBody
mal:composite.comment: An concrete composite example used to build complex composite structures.

mal:field.name: firstItem
mal:field.comment: Example String item.

mal:field.name: secondItem
mal:field.comment: Example Integer item.

mal:composite.name: AbstractComposite
mal:composite.comment: An abstract composite example. This type and all derived types are notably used in the Polymorphic types test procedure.

mal:field.name: firstItem
mal:field.comment: Example String item.

mal:field.name: secondItem
mal:field.comment: Example Integer item.

mal:composite.name: ComplexStructure
mal:composite.comment: A concrete composite example extending an Abstract composite with some common fields.

mal:field.name: third_item
mal:field.comment: Extra Boolean item.

mal:field.name: fourth_item
mal:field.comment: Example Integer item.

mal:field.name: last_item
mal:field.comment: Contained structure.

mal:composite.name: BasicAbstractComposite
mal:composite.comment: A concrete composite example extending an Abstract composite with no field.

mal:composite.name: StructureWithAbstractField
mal:composite.comment: A concrete composite example extending an Abstract composite with a field which is itself an Abstract composite, allowing for defining complex instances.

mal:field.name: abstract_item
mal:field.comment: Contained abstract structure.

mal:field.name: third_item
mal:field.comment: Extra Boolean item.

mal:field.name: fourth_item
mal:field.comment: Example Integer item.

mal:pubsubIP.name: monitor
mal:pubsubIP.comment: This operation initiates a Pub/Sub interaction. It is not implemented by the service provider but by a broker.

mal:errorRef.comment: One or more of the entities identified in the registration do not exist.

mal:pubsubIP.name: monitor2
mal:pubsubIP.comment: This operation initiates a Pub/Sub interaction. It is not implemented by the service provider but by a broker.

mal:errorRef.comment: One or more of the entities identified in the registration do not exist.

mal:submitIP.name: publishUpdates
mal:submitIP.comment: This operation cleans the assertions table, publishes an update as specified by the parameter TestPublishUpdate and checks the header of the Publish message (see 4.1.3). Moreover if an error is expected by the TestPublishUpdate then the operation hangs until a Publish error is raised or a timer ends (see 4.1.10). The header of the Publish error message is checked (see 4.1.4).

mal:submitIP.name: publishRegister
mal:submitIP.comment: This operation cleans the assertions table, registers a publisher as specified by the parameter TestPublishRegister and checks the header of the Publish Register message (see 4.1.5). Moreover if no error is expected by the TestPublishRegister, it checks the header of the Publish Register acknowledgement message (see 4.1.6). Otherwise it checks the header of the Publish Register error message (see 4.1.7).

mal:submitIP.name: publishDeregister
mal:submitIP.comment: This operation cleans the assertions table, registers a publisher as specified by the parameter TestPublishDeregister and checks the header of the Publish Deregister message (see 4.1.5). Moreover if no error is expected by the TestPublishDeregister, it checks the header of the Publish Deregister acknowledgement message (see 4.1.8). Otherwise it checks the header of the Publish Deregister error message (see 4.1.9).
